(Brick K, Watanabe J, Pizzi E). --DbRefMappingFile @downloadDir@/Phenotype_DBRefs/geneid_list__02-19-2010.txt --extDbName %EXT_DB_NAME% --extDbReleaseNumber %EXT_DB_RLS_VER% --columnSpec "primary_identifier" --tableName "DbRefNAFeature" Phenotype links from Genetically Modified Rodent Malaria Parasites: Pberghei.eu hosts a database containing information on genetically modified rodent malaria parasite lines generated by many labs worldwide. Specifically, it contains data of three rodent malaria parasite species; Plasmodium berghei, P. yoelii and P. chabaudi. The aim of this database is to provide the research community access to detailed information on the generation (e.g. disruption, tagging, mutation, transgene expression) and phenotype of genetically modified malaria parasites. The 70-mer oligonucleotides microarray consisted of 6850 probes. From there, 6542 probes (Malaria Genome Oligo Set Version 1.0) were designed and synthesized by Qiagen Operon and 14 probes were obtained from the SpotReport Alien oligo array validation system (Stratagene, CA, USA). The rest of the oligos were selected using ArrayDesigner Version 1 (Premier Biosoft International, CA, USA). Oligonucleotides were dissolved in 1:3 of DMSO:dH2O at a final concentration of 40 µM in preparation for spotting on CMT-UltraGaps slides. Microarraying was done by Genetix Qarray. @downloadDir@/E-MEXP-128_metaData/AH1S2_vs_S8.4.xls >@downloadDir@/E-MEXP-128_metaData/loadMageDoc.config --configfile @downloadDir@/E-MEXP-128_metaData/loadMageDoc.config --extDbRlsSpec '%EXT_DB_NAME%|%EXT_DB_RLS_VER%' Antigenic variation is a survival mechanism developed by the malaria parasite P. falciparum in order to allow for the establishment of a chronic infection. Here we have studied clonal differences in the transcriptomes of two isogenic P. falciparum clones (3D7S8.4 and 3D7AH1S2) of distinct adhesive and antigenic phenotypes employing a P. falciparum 70-mer oligonucleotide microarray. Fifteen transcripts were highly differentially expressed (greater than a 5-fold change) with five transcripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 compared to 3D7S8.4, and ten downregulated. Identified genes encode apical organellar (Gbph2, GBP-related antigen), cell cycle and DNA/RNA processing (SERA-5, RNA-methylase), cell-rescue, defense/virulence (RESA-2, RIFIN, PfEMP1) and hypothetical proteins (PFB0115w, PFI1445w, MAL13P1.121). A number of short and full-length var transcripts were differentially expressed between the clones but one full-length transcript was dominant in both rings and trophozoites (PFD0630c versus PFF0845c). Distinct members of two other variant gene families (phist-a and rif-like), scattered over the subtelomeric areas of the 14 chromosomes, were also found to be clonally and developmentally expressed. Three sibling-clones of 3D7AH1S2 (3D7AH1S1, -S3, -S4) were further studied for the expression of transcripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 compared to 3D7S8.4. Individual var and phist-a genes were found expressed in all of the clones while the expression of a rif-like gene and gbph2 varied in-between the clones. The present data provides evidence for complex transcriptional differences between closely related isogenic P. falciparum of distinct adhesive and antigenic characteristics. makeMageTabConfig.pl @downloadDir@/E-MEXP-439_metaData/CD36_panned_clones.xls >@downloadDir@/E-MEXP-439_metaData/loadMageDoc.config --configfile @downloadDir@/E-MEXP-439_metaData/loadMageDoc.config --extDbRlsSpec '%EXT_DB_NAME%|%EXT_DB_RLS_VER%' P. falciparum cellline experiment: CD36 panned clones (Ring) were hybridized against S8.4 (Ring) makeMageTabConfig.pl @downloadDir@/E-MEXP-494_metaData/KI-KTH_Pf_CGH_UR.xls >@downloadDir@/E-MEXP-494_metaData/loadMageDoc.config --configfile @downloadDir@/E-MEXP-494_metaData/loadMageDoc.config --extDbRlsSpec '%EXT_DB_NAME%|%EXT_DB_RLS_VER%' Identification of genome wide gene copy number polymorphisms in P. falciparum by comparative genomic hybridizations on an oligonucleotide microarray. Trophozoite, Young Schizont, Mature Schizont) using Mature Trophozoite as reference.

There are two datasets: HP and HPE. HP is High Producer (as in gametocytes) and HPE is High Producer "E". HP was mechanically passaged on a weekly basis from mouse to mouse and 10 independent experiments were set up (HPA-HPJ). The parasites were observed, waiting for non-producing parasites to appear. HPE was the chosen one. A deletion in HP was assumed to have created HPE (they are otherwise isogenic) and KO'd the production of gametocytes. In such a scenario the non-producer would quickly overgrow the producer. Both are cloned. --inputDir @downloadDir@/berghei_gss_time_seriesHPE/HPE --configFile @downloadDir@/berghei_gss_time_seriesHPE/HPE/config.txt --externalDatabase %EXT_DB_NAME% --externalDatabaseRls %EXT_DB_RLS_VER% Expression data for the P. berghei for four stages (Rings, Young Trophozoite, Young Schizont, Mature Schizont) using Mature Trophozoite as reference.

Strains of P. falciparum vary in their dependency on sialated red cell receptors for invasion. We show that switching from sialic acid-dependent to independent invasion is reversible and depends on parasite ligand utilisation. Expression of reticulocyte-binding like homologue 4 (PfRh4) correlates with sialic acid-independent invasion and PfRh4 is essential for switching invasion pathways. Differential activation of PfRh4 represents a novel mechanism of invasion pathway control and provides P.falciparum with exquisite adaptability in the face of erythrocyte receptor polymorphisms and host immune responses. (taken from GEO record GSE2878) --studyName 'P.falciparum strain 3D7, SIR2 knockout' --headerMappingFile @downloadDir@/CowmanDuraisingh_arrayData/duraisingh/header_map.xml --resultSubclassView 'RAD::RMAExpress' --arraySubclassView 'RAD::ShortOligoFamily' --quantificationProtocolName 'Robust Multi-Array Average expression measure (Bioconductor affy package)' --quantificationDirectory @downloadDir@/CowmanDuraisingh_arrayData/duraisingh/ Expression profiling of 3D7 silent information regulator 2 homolog (Sir2) knockout at ring stage, 8 hours post-invasion. (taken from GEO record GDS1350) --studyName 'Invasion by P. falciparum merozoites suggests a hierarchy of molecular interactions' --headerMappingFile @downloadDir@/CowmanBaum_arrayData/baum/header_map.xml --resultSubclassView 'RAD::RMAExpress' --arraySubclassView 'RAD::ShortOligoFamily' --quantificationProtocolName 'Robust Multi-Array Average expression measure (Bioconductor affy package)' --quantificationDirectory @downloadDir@/CowmanBaum_arrayData/baum/ Analysis of reticulocyte binding-like homolog 2b (PfRh2b) null mutant 3D7 parasites. D10 isolate naturally lacks PfRh2b. Silencing of PfRh2b, a key invasion ligand, leads to altered invasion receptor dependency. Results provide insight into the molecular basis for invasion via an alternate pathway. --externalDatabaseRls %EXT_DB_RLS_VER% Antigenic variation is a survival mechanism developed by the malaria parasite P. falciparum in order to allow for the establ ishment of a chronic infection. Here we have studied clonal differences in the transcriptomes of two isogenic P. falciparum clones ( 3D7S8.4 and 3D7AH1S2) of distinct adhesive and antigenic phenotypes employing a P. falciparum 70-mer oligonucleotide microarray. Fif teen transcripts were highly differentially expressed (greater than a 5-fold change) with five transcripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 c ompared to 3D7S8.4, and ten downregulated. Identified genes encode apical organellar (Gbph2, GBP-related antigen), cell cycle and DN A/RNA processing (SERA-5, RNA-methylase), cell-rescue, defense/virulence (RESA-2, RIFIN, PfEMP1) and hypothetical proteins (PFB0115w , PFI1445w, MAL13P1.121). A number of short and full-length var transcripts were differentially expressed between the clones but one full-length transcript was dominant in both rings and trophozoites (PFD0630c versus PFF0845c). Distinct members of two other varian t gene families (phist-a and rif-like), scattered over the subtelomeric areas of the 14 chromosomes, were also found to be clonally and developmentally expressed. Three sibling-clones of 3D7AH1S2 (3D7AH1S1, -S3, -S4) were further studied for the expression of tran scripts upregulated in 3D7AH1S2 compared to 3D7S8.4. Individual var and phist-a genes were found expressed in all of the clones whil e the expression of a rif-like gene and gbph2 varied in-between the clones. The present data provides evidence for complex transcrip tional differences between closely related isogenic P. falciparum of distinct adhesive and antigenic characteristics. --DbRefMappingFile --externalDatabase %EXT_DB_NAME% --externalDatabaseRls %EXT_DB_RLS_VER% Winzeler lab (Scripps Research Institute) performed comparative expression analysis on Plasmodium parasite life cycle data derived from P. falciparum blood, sporozoite, zygote and ookinete stages, and P. yoelii mosquito oocyst and salivary gland sporozoites, blood and liver stages and show that type II fatty acid biosynthesis genes are upregulated in liver and insect stages relative to asexual blood stages. --inputDir @downloadDir@/Westenberger_vivax_ExpressionData/westenberger_vivax --configFile @downloadDir@/Westenberger_vivax_ExpressionData/westenberger_vivax/config.txt --tolerateMissingIds --externalDatabase %EXT_DB_NAME% --externalDatabaseRls %EXT_DB_RLS_VER% Sporozoites were purified from dissected mosquitoes fed on monkeys infected with the genome reference strain Salvador I at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, Atlanta, Georgia. Asexual blood stage parasites were obtained from P. vivax-infected patients in Iquitos, Peru. White blood cells were removed by CF-11 cellulose column filtration, asexual parasites were enriched by gradient centrifugation and purified by saponin lysis of RBCs. Total RNA was isolated from purified parasites and subjected to two rounds of RNA amplification for microarray analysis as described previously (Zhou, et al. 2008). Experimental technical replicate hybridizations were performed for the single sporozoite sample and two asexual samples (CM012 and CM013). Gene expression values were calculated using MOID; expression profiles were clustered using OPI as described previously (Zhou, et al. 2008).

Protein binding microarrays are non-organism specific and contain matches to all contiguous 10-mers at least once and non-palindromic 8-mers up to 32 times. The DNA motifs were determined using purified recombinant AP2 domains and the resulting position weight matrix for each AP2 domain was used to search upstream regions for significant matches. The AP2 domain that binds to each motif is indicated at the end of the gene ID. Binding sites are based on sequence matches only and have not been verified in vivo.
